page.title: 18SOCIAL CONCERNS.HOLT.WORCS
page.content: 1.{HOUSING }Owing to the high cost of property in this area most houses are now too expensive for farm labourers. These have now been bought by townsfolk wishing to live in the country.This together with the reduction of tied cottages sometimes causes housing problems for farm-workers, some of whom nowlive in nearby towns. 2.{GIPSIES}The influx of gipsies at harvest time caused problems such as education for their children and noise.These are resolving themselves because with changes in farming methods there is no longer such a demand for them. Those gipsies who remain are gradually being found council housing. 3.{TRAFFIC }Traffic along the east-west route (A4133)can be over-loaded and dangerous.
